data.title: Get Current Census Data for Leicester, VT
data.meta_description: Need Leicester demographics? Get current population, race, age, income & poverty statistics for Leicester, VT from the US Census Bureau.
data.text:
Sources: United States Census Bureau. 2022 American Community Survey 5-Year Estimates. U.S. Census Bureau, American Community Survey Office. Web. 7 December 2023.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2023. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2024. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. Annual Estimates of the Resident Population: April 1, 2010 to July 1, 2019. U.S. Census Bureau, Population Division. Web. May 2021. http://www.census.gov/.

United States Census Bureau. "P2 Hispanic or Latino, and Not Hispanic or Latino by Race." 2020 Census State Redistricting Data (Public Law 94-171) Summary File. U.S. Census Bureau, 2020 Census. Web. 12 August 2021. https://www.census.gov/.

Check out our FAQs for more details.

Population

With 1,007 people, Leicester is the 175th most populated city in the state of Vermont out of 277 cities. But watch out, Leicester, because Jamaica with 1,001 people and Groton with 996 people are right behind you.

Race & Ethnicity

The largest Leicester racial/ethnic groups are White (94.9%) followed by Hispanic (3.8%) and Two or More (0.9%).

Median Income

In 2022, the median household income of Leicester households was $53,424. Leicester households made slightly more than Rutland city households ($53,304) and St. Johnsbury households ($53,047) . However, 7.6% of Leicester families live in poverty.

Median Age

The median age for Leicester residents is 51.3 years young.
